document_data.name: Gholam ibn Jubair
document_data.mainbody:
refs5e         =
}}'''Imam Gholam ibn Jubair''' was the High Priest of the [[Mosque of Free Haku]] in [[Huzuz]] in [[1367 DR]].{{AQ-time}}{{cite book/City of Delights/Gem of Zakhara|69-70}}
document_data.Description: As with most priests of [[Haku]], Gholom wore outlandish [[aba]]s composed of loud colors.
document_data.Personality: Gholam was a very outspoken and free-willed individual; a trait that often lead him to clash with members of the court.
document_data.Activities: Imam Gholam supervised nearly 200 priests and other laymen within the mosque.
document_data.Possessions: Gholam wore a magical turban that granted him ''[[true seeing]]'' and ''[[free action]]'' up to two times per day. He also wore a ''[[ring of fire resistance]]'', ''[[bracers of defense]]'', and used a magical mace.
document_data.Relationships: Imam Gholam had a close relationship with Prince [[Tannous al-Assad]]. Tannous used his considerable wealth to help further Gholam's career and influence.
